title: California will begin backing intentional burns to control wildfire
dot: digraph CaliforniaFireManagement{node[shape=rectangle, style=filled, color=lightblue]; subgraph cluster_0{label="Freethink Weekly Newsletter";"Sign Up"->"Receive Favorite Stories";}subgraph cluster_1{label="California Wildfire Management";"Current Fire Situation"->"6,700 Acres Burned in 2023";"Historical Average"->"1.8 Million Acres Annually";}subgraph cluster_2{label="Fire Management Strategies";"Prescribed Burns"->"Reduce Fuel for Wildfires";"Cultural Burns"->"Promote Ecological Health";"Prescribed Burns"->"Focus on Acreage";"Cultural Burns"->"Focus on Biodiversity";}subgraph cluster_3{label="Prescribed Fire Liability Claims Fund Pilot";"Fund Allocation"->"$20 Million for Loss Coverage";"Encourage Controlled Burns"->"Reduce Wildfire Risks";"Remove Liability Barriers"->"Increase Insurance Market";}subgraph cluster_4{label="Benefits of Controlled Burns";"Fuel Reduction"->"Prevent Large Hot Fires";"Healthy Ecosystem"->"Promote Biodiversity";"Ecological Balance"->"Prevent Overgrowth";}subgraph cluster_5{label="Challenges & Solutions";"Fear of Liability"->"Prescribed Fire Claims Fund";"Suppression of Burns"->"Dense Forests";"Cultural Knowledge"->"Restore Indigenous Practices";}"California Wildfire Management"->"Fire Management Strategies";"Fire Management Strategies"->"Prescribed Fire Liability Claims Fund Pilot";"Prescribed Fire Liability Claims Fund Pilot"->"Benefits of Controlled Burns";"Challenges & Solutions"->"Prescribed Fire Liability Claims Fund Pilot";"Freethink Weekly Newsletter"->"California Wildfire Management"[style=dotted];}
